text: Oct. 16. A 0.33 l bottle that poured a hazy golden body with medium sized head. Weak aroma, malty, some fruits (maybe even from hops) and biscuit. Lightly sweet flavor, all malty (biscuit, grainy, fruity) with some bitterness towards the finish in lemony, herbal, peppery way. Much less hoppy than expected, also, didnt pick up any smoked malt unfortunately. Expected more generally, this is just OK.

W aromacie dzieje się niewiele, zbożowe nuty podbite przez nieco czerwonoowocowe estry, lekko, ale przyjemnie. W smaku podwyższona pełnia i odczucie gładkości, zboże, lekka ziemistość, ziołowe nutki chmielowe, goryczki nie za wiele. Zero karmelu mimo karmelowej barwy, szanuję! Nic wielkiego, a cieszy.

moje pierwsze spotkanie z tym stylem (tak mi się wydaje), ogolnie w aromacie słodowe, jasne pieczywo, no i cos w stylu cukierkow mietowych, może lekko jakieś jasne owoce, w smaku średnie ciało, z niska goryczka, dosyć odswieżająca, posmak bułki z mietówkami, podsumowujac to tego sie spodziewałem, jest ok

Bottle 0,33L. Clear, dark golden color with a finger of frothy, white head. Suprisingly, not much of aroma here. Very weak aroma of tea and touch of fruits. Taste is light to medium bitter with a lot of crispness at the start and dry, heavy bitter finish. Looks excellent, lacks of aroma, taste is very good, palate is ok.

Bottle. Pours a clear amber beer with a small white head on top. Aroma is bready and grassy, some notes of cardboard. Flavor is quite bitter and freshly hopped, hints of the citrus fruits, malt in the background. Very average beer, average carbonation and short light bitter aftertaste. Ok.

Bottle, 0.33l. Cloudy golden amber color with large frothy off-white head and average sparkling appearance. Aroma is grainy, yeasty, herbal and mild fruity. Taste starts light to medium sweet grainy, follows fruity, grassy and a bit smoky, mouthfeel is crisp and dry, while finish is medium bitter. Light to medium body, thin texture and lively carbonation in palate. I was a bit worried because of initial gusher, but turned out into completely ok and decently drinkable brew...
Not bad, but not so extraordinary as the design of the bottle. Similar to a simple APA with strong bitterness at the ending. Light amber color.

Appearance: Dull orange, hazy. Nice, creamy white head.
Aroma: Light malt, light hops. Some fruit.
Taste: Light malts, light hops, slight metal and shy fruits. Pretty smooth.
Bought: Craft Gallery, 330 ml, CHF 5.90
Info: 5/11-2016, BB: 4/9-2017
backlog. Amber with hint of burned wood, grass, hey and malts. Quite malty on the tongue. Slight smoke. Slightly bitter. Meeh

Bottle. Sensoric. Amber, medium hazy with small, white, semi-sensed head. Poor head retention and lacing. Aroma is dull, lightly citrus and floral. Taste is medium bitter, nothing special semi-dry. Light to medium body, creamy texture, average carbonation, finish is semi-dry and semi-bitter. In general aroma and taste are like old, oxidized well hopped citrus IPA, but this one is still refreshing, Im not very familiar with this style.

Örökké tartó, hatalmas, tömör hab, borostyán szín. Illatában inkább egy belgian ale, bár a háttérben érezhető egy picike lágeres stílusjegy is. Íze is öszvér, lágeres dominancia, de egy édeskésebb, belgian ale-s vonal is betolakszik. A nagyobb szénsavtartalom miatt kicsit pezsgös érzetű. Keserűje a pilzeniekhez mérhető és van egy kis olajos vonása is, ami lágerekre nem éppen jellemző. Utóíze keserű, édeskés és egy darabig az élesztős tapadásossága is megmarad. Közepesen testes. Érdekes ízvilág, jól megmutatja a stílus összvér jellegét.

Bottle at Glød, july 21st 2015. Clear amber body with a small white head. Aroma is malty with herbal hops, mild citrus notes. Taste is bitter with a sweet and fruity yeast note, herbal and malty finish. Didnt catch the smoked malt.

Aroma of honey and citrus fruit, taste of lemon honey-like sweetness and some grassy notes. Nice creamy and fizzy mouthfeel. Went great together with honey glazed salmon and cucumber salad with peanut/coriander pesto.
Copper colour. Aroma has some orange and bergamot. Flavour is fruity at first. It becomes drier and a touch smokey in the finish.
Bottle at csakajo. Hazy yellow colour with a small white head. Nose of grains. Taste is low bitterness. Nothing special overall.

Bottle from Kihoskh, Copenhagen - golden pour with white head. Citrus fruity aroma and taste with some nice floral herbal hoppy action, picking up some pineapple and grapefruit, some caramel malts, light yeasty notes, nice brew.
Bottle. Hazy to cloudy pale yellow color, fluffy white head. Aroma of floral citrus. Taste has subtle lemon. Decent. Non comprendo the name or the war list. Inside joke?

Bottle 0.33l at Majstor za pivo Belgrade Serbia. Taste with Ogi.21.12.2015.Pour it hazy orange color with small white head.Aroma of ham staying in a fridge for a while. Taste sweet caramel, nice pleasent smoke, ok interesting but maybr not my beer.

How: Bottle.
Where: Kihoskh, Copenhagen.
Appearance: Hazy golden colour with a white head.
Aroma: Citrus, hops, grapefruit, floral.
Body: Medium body and carbonation.
Flavour: Hops, malt, fruit, some floral notes.

Bottle @ home from To Øls Christmas calendar. Aroma of citrus and some fruity hops, notes of yeast. Light hazy golden with white mostly lasting head. Taste is moderate bitter and dry. Light body, dry feel, avg. carb., bitter and dry finish.
More hops added than in the average steamer, but with a kept crispy freshness and a slight touch of smoke.

Una birra curiosa, discretamente profumata, in bilico tra sentori dolciastri ed erbacei. Pane, luppolo, malto, cereali, un pizzico di buccia dagrumi. Particolare, non spiacevole ma poco interessante.

Bottle sample at a tasting at Alexei and Raphaelas. Thanks Troubles. As To Øl Primal Pils. Hazy straw with a thick white head. Straw and malt aroma, malty, bitter taste followed by skunky hops. Very fizzy, medium body and bitter finish.
opalescent golden colour, moderate sized off-white head; aroma of bread, some lemony notes, hints of fruitiness and smoke; taste is the same; good beer
the aroma is malty and spicy with shades of herbs and hop... the taste is malty, hoppy and spicy with notes of herbs, pimento, pine needles and grain... bitter, spicy and dry aftertaste...
On tap. Golden color with one finger haze. Citrus and slight bread aroma. Citrus, slight pepper. Pretty good.

0.33l bottle thanks to Lore. Murky golden body, white head. Aroma of bread, citruses, pineapple and some smoke. Taste of bread, smoke, grapes and pineapple. Nice beer, but I have to admit that I dont really get the connection between the label and the name.
330ml bottle from Brewdog.com. Pours hazy amber with good white head. Odd one this. Herbey, smokey, pilsnery. Bizarre.

Pours haze golden amber with foamy stable white head.
Aroma without note of an alcohol, with fruity hints like pine, grapefruit, citrus etc.
Flavor is fruity sweet, with hints of pine, grapfruit, lemon, but at the same time tomahawk hop make it very bitter.
Malt sweetness is mild medium, hop bitterness is high for that style.
Body is soft, carbonation is low, finish is dry bitter.

Havent had too many steam beers so I was expecting something like Anchor Steam. So I was comfortable surprised here. A decent nose of citrus, pineapple hops/ Light bodied with a little sharpness and hints of smoke which add a lovely twist. Very drinkable. Dont get the reference for Stalin and various wars though.

From the bottle. Stable white head. Nose is strong citric hops not to intrusive. Resin and risted malts. Taste is soapy citic, some smoke there to. Astringent herbal lemon peel hops in the finish, long lasting. Good, easy, winning drink to me...

Cest gentil. Pas désagréable mais ça me laisse sans voix ... Un style que je ne connaissais pas et que franchement jai du mal a situer précisément ... Dégustation terminée sur un plat épicé et citronné, elle a eu alors plus dampleur. Fruité nettement plus expressif aussi en fin de dégustation en se réchauffant dans le verre.
Bottle a golden yellow colored beer with a white head aroma malts spices citrus some smoke and hops flavor spices citrus pineapple fruits and bitter hops

Bottle 33cl / Botella 33cl.
@ Cervezorama 2.0.
A: Golden / Dorado.
T/S: Hops, fruity, citrusy, slightly yeasty and malty / Lupulo, afrutado, citrico, ligeramente a levadura y malta.

(bottle, 33cl) Hazy, golden colour with a medium-sized and slightly off-white foamy head. Yeasty, herbal and slightly fruity hoppy aroma with notes of pineapples and citrus, accompanied by bready malt and a whiff of smoke. Mildly bitter and slightly sweet flavour, medium to light bodied with a prickly carbonation. Dry-ish, mildly bready malty base with hints of caramel, shy smoky notes, as well as a fruity and herbal-spicy hops character, getting fruitier towards the dry and moderately bitter finish with a balanced level of bready and subtle smoky malt. Likeable and rounded hybrid beer. 27.III.15
Bue en bouteille de 33cl. Très bel équilibre, houblon bien présent et qui s'efface progressivement pour laisser la place à la fleur, aux agrumes. Cool.

Bue en bouteille de 33cl à la brasserie.
Couleur blonde. Mousse présente. Effervescence forte 
Nez sur le houblon et le pet. 
Bouche sur la mandarine très sèche. Continuité sur le citron confit.
33cl bottle. Random pick turned out awesome. Very well balanced pils with nice smokey after touch.

Cloudy orange, tall head of big bubbles forming later a hill in the middle. Aroma of tropical fruit, blossom, citrus, some yeast. Medium body. Oily texture. Medium bitter flavour with citric fruitiness. Long hoppy finish.

Мягкий солодов& вкус, довольн& сильная хмелева& горечь. В целом - пиво качеств& но немного банальн& Интерес& этикетк& бутылки с указани& войн, где применя& Орган Сталина (Катюша хотя не знаю насколь& этично делать такую этикетк&
Bottle, 330 ml at Svijet Piva, shared with JFK10000. Pours orange with medium dense white head. Caramel malts, fruit, light to medium hoppiness.
Bottle. Hazy orange, white foam. Aroma: citrus, floral and spicy hops. Aroma: citrus, a little dark and white bread, some smoke, good fruitiness, average bitterness.

Bottle at S&G Mikkeller tasting.
APPEARANCE: clear blond beer, small stable white head.
NOSE: hoppy, salt?
TASTE: hoppy, salt, dry, little bitter

On tap at le sur mesure in Nantes. Cloudy amber color with a foamy white head. Medium body and medium carbonation. Aroma of fruit and hops. A bit bitter at the end. A nice summer beer but a bit strong maybe (6 abv)
Weicher, hopfig herber Beginn. Deutlich steigender Hopfen, auch die Herbe nimmt an Intensität zu und wird etwas trocken. Vollmundig, rund. 9/11/11/11/6/11
Clear yellow color, medium sized white head. Slightly sweet aroma, citrusy and malty. Bittersweet taste, some hops. Lively carbonation, medium body. Expected more. (Svijet Piva 0,33l bottle)

0,33L bottle (as Primal Pils, shared by suurjuust, thanks!). Pours golden with off-white head. The head stays for a moment. Aroma is hoppy, grassy. Flavor is sweet and bitter, grass, and citrus. Finish is resin bitter. Overall: ok

Hazy pale yellow color, big white head. Aroma of flowers, citrus, fruitiness, malt. Taste is about the same. Medium body, soft to average carbonation. Bittersweet. Sympatisch.-- rated with beerbasher/winphone
Slightly hazy amber. soapy white head. Hoppy nose, caramel, malt. Finish is grassy-herbal bitterness. Fairly smooth and very drinkable, not mind blowing, but the fruity hop profile is nice.
Bottle 0.33l. Hazy yellow liquid with average off white head. Medium body and carbonation. Aroma of dry herbs. Fruity, herby and flowery taste with flowery aftertaste.
Nice clear orange color. The smell is very thin. Taste is weirdly citrus tart with an unpleasant bitterness. The aftertaste is okay.
Hazy orange color with big white head. Hoppy, flowery, fruity aroma, a bit oranges, a bit butter. Taste is bitter, refreshing, marmalade, bitter finish. Thick mouthfeel, soft carbonation. Not bad!
light hoppy aroma,golden, clear, white foam, light sweetness, lightly bitter, light body, watery light fruit finish
Light golden coloured and hazy. Has a white head, lasting. Hoppy aroma, fruity, eksotic. Sweet malts, faint smoke.
Bottle. Creamy White good mostly lasting head. Yellow colour. Moderate malty and hoppy aroma. Moderate bitter flavor. Hay. Average moderate bitter finish. Oily palate. Week passionfruit note!

330ml bottle from De Bierkoning, Amsterdam. Yellow Orange, good foamy head. Flowery yeasty lemon toffee aroma. Flowery biscuit flavour. Creamy texture. Somwhere between a thick smooth lager & Belgian beer.

330ml bottle shared by djoeye. Huge bubbly white head. Close to clear golden body. Spotty lacing. Lemony hops and bread on the nose. Smooth flavour of herbal hops, lemon and pine. Mild dry hoppy ending. Fine drinkability (Tromsø 20.04.2015).

Huge pearl white head, clear golden body. Aroma of peaches, hops, grass, grapefruit, well hopsy stuff. Tastes fresh hops, peaches, grapefruit peel, good hops. Half dry and fruity finish. Good body and feel. 

33cl btl, BB260217, [[email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */s2015-04-20]

Bottled 330ml. -from Svijet Piva Zagreb. Clear golden coloured, small white head, low carbonation, mild floral hoppy nose. Moderate sweet malty, floral hoppy, mild fruity and light (pretty artificial) whiff of smoke with rather bitter finish.

Bottled. Pours clear golden with an average, lacing and white head. Aroma of yeast, apricot, flowers, spicy notes and herbal hops. Sweet flavor that ends up dry and nice bitter. Light to medium bodied, oily texture and soft carbonation. A nice, crisp brew. ⭐️⭐️⭐️
Easy drinking and refreshing brew. Hazy beer with some interesting hop notes. Some sweetness.

14-MAR-2015, bottle @home, present from Marianne, Thx:-), from Magasin.
Hazy orange/golden with low lasting White head. Straw, hops, grape fruit, pine, Herbs. Dry-hopped?
Full bodied for the style. Medium+ body, creamy, med+ carbonation. Nice.
2.5.2014. Golden with white head. Aroma is tempting, a combination of malty pilsener with some fruitiness and hops. Flavour is smooth with lemon, grass, floral. Refreshing, very nice.
Bottle from Wine Emporium 050315. Not bad and quite tasty. Full bodied and easy to drink.

Pours dark orange. Hops and citrus, a very clear and crisp taste to it, with very little bitterness, or at least it melds into the overall flow of the beer. Corn and a little bit of a smokey aftertaste. I actually really enjoyed this one. Easy, smooth beer to drink, but not boring.

As To Øl Primal Pils. Really hazy orange looks with nice big head on top and lots of lacing. Aroma is very hoppy, there is tropical fruits, citrus, blood orange. Nice and fresh. Taste has sweet fruits, little bit of barley, no smoke but really bitter after taste. Medium body with medium carbonation. Touch of smoke went by for me but still very nice beer.
Hazy golden colour. Aroma is bready with some hoppiness, Light, bready, citrus taste.

Bottle as Primal Pils. Gift from Helsinki or Espoo. Pours a hazy amber colour. Head is off-white, quite big, retention and lacing ok. Nose is sweet, somewhat citrusy, plastic, band-aid... Tastes the same... But then the smokiness... I get quite a lot of this, and both in aroma and taste, it feels like someones melting a barbie doll with a magnifying glass. Harsh bitterness in the finish. Not at all pleasant. Not sure if its supposed to be like this or not. Maybe gone off? Well, hooray anyway - this is the first To Øl beer that I can say I dont like. Will try and have it again one day.
Fast klares goldenes Bier mit einer fingerbreiten weißen Schaumkrone. Geruch leicht fruchtig, hopfig, ganz wenig Kraut, trocken. Geschmack süß fruchtig, hopfig, dezent bitter, würzig, trocken.
Bottle from Cotteridge Wines; hazy golden amber pour with a bubbly white head, bread and a hint of citrus on the aroma, taste is malty, a hint of smoke, bitter lemon, whole grain bread.
330ml bottle. Pours dark orange with a medium head. Aroma is creamy, hoppy tangerine and orange. Taste is creamy orange with a bitter finish. Simple stuff, hugely drinkable.

330ml bottle. Pours a slightly hazy light amber. Aroma is lots of fresh citrussy hops. Really nice floral hoppy taste. Soft peach and melon notes with a floral aftertaste. I reckon this would be great stuff for a hot summers day.

courtesy of Maria Rothacher - hazy orange beer under a solid white foam left; light smokey and earthy aroma with hints of fruits; medium-bodied; soft palate and quite creamy; pretty bitter and long smokey, earthy and hazelnutty finish - balanced, uncomplicated and well-crafted

From 330 ml bottle. Pours a mostly clear yellow-gold with a fluffy lasting white head. Aromas are quite light but some lemon, corn and a floral note come through. Taste is crisp fresh fruit (green apple, peach) up front with a juicy citrus note in the mid-palate. Slips away to a gently fruity finish with a light pepper note coming through. Fruit aftertaste. Not complex but a nice summer style beer.

Tap at Le Senk. Classic pilsnery aroma, light yeast, light fruity hops, liggtest smoke. Almost clear golden to orange colour, stable head. Taste is generally as aroma suggests. Fruity hops, moderate bitterness, only hints of smoke which I might detect only because of description. Malt stays in the background. Rather full body yet easily drinkable. Overall well balanced beer, very good one.

330ml bottle. Barely clear, yellow-ish golden colour with average to huge, firm, frothy, fairly lasting, moderately lacing, white head. Minimally smoky aroma, hints of vegetables, mushrooms, a cautious, peppery spicy, yeasty touch. Taste is slightly smoky, combines with grassy, minimally peppery spicy yeasty and minimally biting bitter hoppy overtones, vegetable basis. Very well balanced, overall quite cautious; Saison-adjacency.

330ml bottle. Pours a hazy medium gold, with a smallish off-white head, which lasts well and leaves decent lacing. Floral and spice hops mix with white bread malt and a little smoke to create the aroma. Spicy, floral hops up front give way to soft, quite light caramel and white bread malt in the mid-palate, with a smoky finish. A decent session ale, but nothing spectacular.

Bottle, 0.33l. Hazy golden colour with small white head. Medium carbonation. Fruity and hoppy aroma. Taste of citrus with moderate bitter aftertaste. Not even a hint of smoke in aroma and taste. Overall very good beer with cool label.

clear yellow, smooth white head.
very mild fruity almost flowery citrussy aroma, very light.
flavor is yeasty, malty, spicy, quite dry, wild yeasty notes, tastes a bit like a super dry saison.

Barwa i piana: złota w stronę pomarańczowej, początkowo klarowna, natomiast po dolaniu dolnej części zdecydowanie nieklarowna. Piana lekko zabarwiona (żółto -biała), drobno pęcherzykowa, obfita, dosyć trwała. 

Aromat: słodowy (zbożowy, tostowy, lekko karmelowy) oraz chmielowy (lekko owocowy, ziemisty, może miętowy) i nieco estrowy (jabłko, ananas, cytrusy). Do tego niewielkie nuty utlenienia oraz zbytnia, nie do końca przyjemna alkoholowość. 

Smak: słodowy (j.w.), ale raczej wytrawny niż słodki. Lekko owocowy (w granicach normy) oraz wyraźnie alkoholowy i goryczkowy. Balans zdaje się być przesunięty w kierunku chmielu 

Goryczka i odczucie w ustach: dosyć wysoka goryczka, lekko drażniąca i zalegająca. Średnia pełnia, niskie wysycenie i nieco ściągająca końcówka. Finisz wyraźnie wytrawny, ale mianem rześkiego bym go nie nazwał. Alkohol momentami rozgrzewa przełyk. 

Piwo, które zakupiłem dość przypadkowo, chcąc osiągnąć wartość zamówienia potrzebną na darmową wysyłkę. Przyznam, że nie wiązałem z nim zbyt dużych nadziei i pod tym kątem można powiedzieć, iż spełniło moje oczekiwania. Jest to piwo parowe (steam beer) znane również jako California Cammon. Do piany nie można mieć zastrzeżeń, natomiast barwę początkowo ładną psuje pod koniec zmętnienie. W aromacie również atakują nas nuty utlenia oraz nadmiernej alkohlowości, choć trzeba przyznać, że piwo jest w górnej granicy stylu. W smaku jest podobnie, zatem trudno to piwo określić jako rześkie. Ciekawszym przykładem tego stylu, jest z pewnością Anchor Steam Beer czy Flying Dog Old Scratch. O cenie tego trunku nie wspominam.
Small white head... opage orange/yellow colour... smell sweet fruity sugar malts. Taste malts somewhat sweet herby.. shared by joes

Mijn eerste California Common, het begin is goed, lekker fris en fruitig aroma citrus, sinaasappel, hooi, lichte den maar ook wat lichte rookmouten komen door. De looks zijn ook aardig, wat wazig oranje met witte kraag. 
Smaken zijn redelijk stevig bittertje, matig zoet, fruitigheid van citrus, sinaasappel, wat gekookte groentenvocht, gras en rookmouten komen terug. zwak tot medium body, dun, lage co2. afdronk wat lang bitter. Ben er helaas niet weg van. En waarom dit bier noemen naar een oorlogstuig (Katyusha - Stalins orgel) begrijp ik niet...

33cl bottle @El lúpulo Feroz, Oviedo. 16-02-2014.
In short: a subtle tart and smoky beer.
Pours some hazy golden with white head. Short head retention, some lacing. Subtle smoky and some tart aromas. Light to medium body, some crispy texture, average carbonation. Taste is citrusy, subtle smoky and spicy. Quite refreshing but a bit of off flavours. Larry, you were freckin´ crazy about this one, i don´t know why.

Hazy golden with a lasting white head. Fruity hop aroma with grapefruit, orange and peach, along with a bready malt note, that may include a hint of smoke (or maybe its just because I know its there). Fruity hop flavour with a good, sweetish malt backbone, and definitely some smoke in the aftertaste

Smell of hay, snoke. Amber colour, white head. Aroma of grain, yeast, smoke. Some mango in finish. Sweet with a faint bitter finish. Mild palate, plentiful but soft carbon. Somewhat yeasty but otherwise nice.

Bought as To Öl Primal Pils. A pale aleish look and taste. Rather good and drinkable. Wasnt expecting this as the title was a pils. More please!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle, 6%. Slightly hazy amber with small off-white head. Aroma is malt, caramel, hop, grass, citrus and fruit. Flavour is malt, caramel, littl grainy, medium sweet, little grass, little citrus and medium bitter.
A bit smoky, a good bunch bitter. Nice and hazy appearance. Also, an incredible political label to boot.

Bottled. Overall a blend of a sourness, hopiness and a mild malt backbone. Aroma of fruits, pears, grapefruit, some citrus. Color hazy golden with a thick one inch stable head thats keeps a good long lacing. Taste is a bit sour due to the hopiness, bitter fruits, bitter hops finish. Very refreshing. A damn good beer!
Tap @ Fairbar. Clear light bronze pour with a light head. Grains, cereal, some light bitterness, herbal notes and green grass.

330 ml bottle from Hop Corner. Light sunrise orange, pretty clear, with a small, creamy but not too persistent white head. Hoppy and slightly toasted nose, a hint of honey and grass, slightly dusty, some generic caramel malts. Big astringency and mild sourness, quite sweet and not as balanced being no bitter at all. Pleasent herbal and resinous aftertaste, but its not exactly easy to drink. Average carbonation, medium body, slightly oily texture. Not for me, I guess

Malty flavor with hints of fruitiness. Very bitter but slightly fruity aroma. The aftertaste has a nice bitterness that fills the upper part of the mouth of a weak moment. Mediocre beer. Follow me @ Kung av öl @ Facebook for more pictures and ratings.
Draught @ Fairbar, Århus. Pours yellow with a white head. Aorma of malt, yeast, grass, flowers. Flavor is malt, yeast, grassy hops, flowers. Medium body, soft carbonation, light bitter finish. 060914
Nice steam beer, some fruitiness, I didnt get the smoke. Well balanced beer, but nothing too impressive.

Bottle 0,33ltr: Hazy orange colored brew with an mildly dry bitter taste with an well hidden hints of smoked and some fruitiness. Dont get the beer labels with all those conflicts, but the beer is great.

Bottle. Aroma has pine, grain and citrus. 

Taste has pine, grain, wheat and fruit. Very bitter long aftertaste. Nice body. More like an IPA than a pils.

Flaska från Alko, Finland. 
Vacker grumlig orangebrun vätska med ett tjockt vitt skum. 
Doftar lätt rökigt och jäst. 
Härlig balanserad smak med en mycket bra beska. Viss syrlighet. 
Överraskande god!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle. Pours a clear orange-amber with a large and firm white head. The aroma has notes of straw, toasted malts, citrusy hops, grass. The flavour is light toasted malt, peachy and citrusy hops, straw, smoke. The finish is crisp and bitter with a light lingering smokiness.

Bottle. Pours slightly hazy dark golden with creamy medium off-white, persisting head. Medium carbonation. Aroma is fruity, hoppy, with light notes of malts, pale caramel, ripe peaches. Some smoke in the very far end. Smooth taste, sweet, light bitterness, and a very light astringence. Smooth bitter finish. Very drinkable.

Blond mostly clear beer with small head. Fruity, spices, anise, Belgian yeast style. Medium bitter, tasty malt, well developed. Wheat did a good job here. Nice brew. Still not sure why the wars are mentioned on the label. :-) (33cl bottle from Bière Révolution shared with Guus and Tim)

BOTTLE 33CL from Cunningham. Thank, Henrik!

Look: almost clear golden-amber, white frothy head.
Aroma: citrus and spicy herbal hops, lightly toasted malts.
Taste: again citrus and spicy herbal hops, dry herbal bitter finish. Clean and dry.
Pours hazy yellow with thin, white head. Very fruity aroma with orange and citrus. Nice bitter taste but not too sharp. Kind like IPA with the hops toned way down. Soft mouthfeel and carbonation.

33cl bottle. Pours clear light amber with one finger of creamy off white head. Smell is light sweet fruits with vegetal hoppy and light smoked notes. Taste is malts and light fruits again. Almost no smoke taste in the mouth. Good final hoppy bitterness, dry finish with vegetal flavors.

Draft pour at The Beagle, Chorlton. Interesting beer. Did not realize the style of this at first, as the lager and yeasty notes mix with a pale ale esque feel. Did not detect the smoke, though there is a quality in here that does not come through at first.

Huge, dense, just off-white head, fed by lively carbonated clear golden beer with faint orange sheen. Fragrant USA hops; exotic fruit, rosewater, melon, ever so slightly meaty/phenolic. Bitter, hoppy, finish being resin mixed with (exotic) fruit. Grapefruit(peel). Only after quite a few good sips, a new flavour appears that, knowing it, is indeed smoke(y/d). More obvious is the fattiness the blurb speaks about, making it indeed more than light bodied, and quite slick/oily. The beer is (more than) OK. But has it really become that hard to find a fitting name for a beer? Stalins organ - PUH-lease!
Bottle 0.33l from local Alko, Helsinki. BBE 26/02/17. Colour is clear copper with small white head. Aromas and flavours: Some fruits, citrus, some grape, grain, hops and malts. Cant find any smoke.
On tap at Biercab. Copper colour with white head. Malt aroma. Sweet, malt, citric, yeast taste. Medium body.

Amber /copper color, little hazy. 
Aroma has citrusy and resiny hops. 
Flavor surprisingly has some roasted notes along with piney hops.

Presenta color amarillo pálido de burbuja muy fina, media capa de espuma de retención media, aromas a levadura, cítricos (limón y citronela) y herbales, en boca entrada suave y maltosa con amargor equilibrado, notas a florales y a lúpulo, bien balanceada con pos gusto interesante y final algo picante.

Bottle @ home shared with Dutchdrebus. Clear orange golden color, medium sized white head. Smell and taste malts, lightly hops, lightly bitter, slightly hay and a touch of herbs. Average to medium body and carbonation. Decent.

Bottle @ benzai. Clear golden orange colour with a medium sized white head. Smells hops, fruity, fresh, citrussy. Tastes hops, fresh, bitter, sweetish. Not getting the smokyness the label advertises, but thats fine. Thin to medium body, nice carbo.

Bona cervesa, és equilibrada i gustosa.
Buena cerveza, es equilibrada y sabrosa.
Draught at Mikkeller & Friends. Clear golden colour with a white head. Aroma and flavour of malt, hops, grass and citrus.
Bottle. Pours orange/golden color, white head. Aroma is hoppy, bit smoked. Taste is bitter, bit sourish, smoked, grapefruit, herbs.

Bottle from Mikkeller Beer Shop. Clear golden with a big off-white head. Aroma is sweet, malty and moderate hoppy - grass and citrus. Flavor is medium sweet and moderate bitter. Dry and moderate bitter finish. 100714
Bottle @ CBC 2014.Pours hazy orange with a white head. Aroma is citrus, grain, light smoke, Sweet malty with a citrus and grassy medium bitterness, finish is medium bitter.

Pours amber with a large lasting head.
Nose shows spicy and grassy hops, grainy pilsner malt and faint peat. A fruity note enters later hinting at pear and apple.
The peat is more evident as a flavours, supported by spicy noble hops with a soft minty twist. Lots of grainy malt underneath.
Carbonation is a little excessive.

Bottle from Loglog.Orange golden color with thick white head. Aroma of oranges, tangerines, bready malt. Strong hoppy taste with grapefruit, oranes, grapefruit zest, pines, bready malt, toasted notes. Tasty.
33cl thanks to ruigo. Color is gold. Head is thin and white. Body is crispy and well executed. Taste is medium to high bitter. Aroma is nice and hoppy.
Birra particolare, caratterizzata da una leggera luppolatura fruttata e una punta di affumicato. Il gusto è molto morbido e risulta fresca e beverina, ma non lascia ricordi intensi.

Bottle 33 cl thanks to jduvet! On June 24, 2014.Hazy golden color, white head. Sweet, citrus, cheese (more so from oxidized hops than from actual cheese) scent. Bitter, hoppy, resin taste. Bitter, citrus aftertaste. Fizzy mouthfeel, high bitterness.Rather huge focus on the bitterness and sort of the hop character, way too bitter for my liking. Cant make out the smoke anywhere. Would expect a steam beer to have the yeast/fermentation character take place and show off, not the hops. The beer may be fermented as of a steam beer, but the recipe used with hops do not allow the base style to shine.
Tap @ Mikkeller, Stefansgade. Nice head with good duration. Color is amber. Aroma and taste are malt, caramel, grass, hops and flowers.

Bottle @ #h-J14 as Primal Pils, thanks bluus, 20/06/14. Pours a hale orange with a medium-sized white head. Aroma is grainy, quite a lot of lemon and lemon peel, light pink grapefruit. Taste is very lemony, some peel in it too. The light touch of pink grapefruit is detectable again. Fairly full with good, strong carbonation.

Bottled from a shop in Helsingör
Hazy golden eith a white, flugit head. 
Grassy, hoppy, fruity, piney aroma and flavour. 
Medium to high bitterness. .
bottle at home ... june 2014 ... golden amber ... soft white thin white head ... golden yellow ... thin white lacing ... soft grassy fruit .. soft dry fruits ... soft lemon...
Bottle at Craigs. Pours golden, lemon nose, sweet, dry, a bit thin and harsh.

Bottle at home. High fluffy and long lasting white head. Hazy yellow body. Mild malt straw lemon aroma. Pretty hoppy malt straw lemon smoke flavor with soap notes, low carbonation and a long dry bitter and smoky finish.

(Bottle, 0.33 l - BB 25.02.17, from Alko, 20140619) The beer poure golden and clear. Its head was medium sized and white. Aroma had fruitiness, sweetness and grass. Palate was medium bodied with mefium carbonation. Flavours were fruitiness, grass, sweetness, malts and bitterness. Aftertaste was sweet. hoppy and bitter, Too sweet but otherwise tasty.
Draught at Mikkeller & Friends. Pale yellow with a white head. Aroma medium malty (caramel) and hoppy (grassy, citrusy). Flavor medium sweet and bitter. Medium body.

Bottle, thanks to k0mpsa. Cloudy golden color with medium white head. Aromas of fresh hops, malts, citrus fruits, mainly lime, some flowers also. Definitely complex nose for this kind of beer. Palate is balanced with nice acids and fresh hops, malts, hint of lemon. Very nice.
Pale yellow, big head. Fruity, grassy, citric. Smoky flavour very slight., maybe. Medium-heavy bitterness. Refreshing, yet boring.

Bottled (as Primal Pils, from Alko, Vaasa). Goldeny amber colour with a small white creamy head. Aroma is mild toasted notes, some bready notes and quite much on the hoppy side too. Flavour is quite strong on the hops with some mild toffee, bread and also some toasted notes. Wellbalanced and very refreshing beer.

ivorywhite head disappears without lacing. goldenblonde colour. aroma is yeasty, pot-pourri/young beer, mango. taste is like aroma, slight sour with a pronounced bitter finish. medium body and carbonation. nice, although i didnt notice the smokiness. bottle 33 cl / bbf feb-2017
Bottle. Cloudy golden color. Aromatic hop aroma. Sweetish hoppy flavor with caramel. Medium-full body, medium carbonation. Nice.

(Draught at Mikkeller Stockholm, 4 June 2014) Pale amber colour with foamy, off-white head. Malty, fruity nose with notes of citrus, apricots, dried fruit and toasty malt. Malty, fruity taste with dried apricots, citrus, toasty malt and a generous citric bitterness in the finish. Medium body, with a touch of sweetness. Fresh, tasty and quite drinkable. Nice one.

Very good steam beer with lots of hops and a hint of smoke and spices. 

Deep golden with a cream colored head with moderate retention and lacing. Hoppy aroma with a hint of spice. Nice steam flavor augmented with the lingering smoke aroma and a tinge of spice. Recommended.

Bottle from Mikkeller & Friends. I love everything about this beer, the style, the name, the label, the brewery but the beer itself. Maybe its because the CC-style is so dominated by one major beer for me, its a decent brew its just not THAT brew.

0,33 l bottle. 
Aroma is cereal, smoke, spruce. 
Dark golden color. Hazy and with a frothy tan head. 
Medium body. Average carbonation. Smoky-bitter-dry finish.
33 cl bottle @ home. Pours clear amber with a white head that leaves a little lacing. Aroma and flavour are caramel, citrus peel, and subtle smoke - with a dry finish.

Color: clear blond beer with copper reflexion medium carbonation and high white foam. Smell: nice wheat malty nose with some grass presence. Taste: nice malty taste with good hoppy balance. Aftertaste: fresh and good equilibrium of malt and bitterness.

330 mml Bottle tasted on 27/05/2014. Hazy and clear golden colour with a light foamy head. The aroma is very hoppy and the taste is bitter citrus and light smoky. Aftertaste is dry and hoppy. Carbonation is ok with some bubbles. Next one please!

On tap. Pours a slightly cloudy amber with very light white head. Aromas of of mangos, oranges, toasted malts and light toffee.
Flavors of mangos, bitter citrus rind, a bit of grain, and resin. Sweet and fruity. Nice.
Nose is quite soapy, red grape, yeast whiff, damp clothes, feel is mediumbroad, taste is decent celery, medium hops bite, yellow pepper sweetness, later weak bile

Sunset orange, foamy white head. Big fruity aroma more typical for an IPA rather than for a pilsner. Medium bodied, crispy mouth feel, grassy bitterness, some sweetness and alcohol. Very drinkable and refreshing yet with (some) fruitiness more typical to an american pale ale than for a pilsner. Very good beer.
33cl, new exclusive Danish brew Anno 2014, from De Hopduvel Gent, complex brew, malty/fruity and slightly smoked/woody, balanced, clear, rocky head, nice brew
330 ml bottle from the CBC vending machine. Hazy golden with large white head. Aroma soft and malty; grain and wood. Taste of pale malts, birch, mild smoke, grass and faint fruit. Nicely balanced

330ml bottle from Alko
BBE 26/02/17 - Pours clear golden with a foamy white head. Aroma of smoked malts, leather, hops, buttery notes, grass and citrus. Taste is crisp malty, mildly smoked, leathery and quite hoppy with notes of grass, butter and leather. Finish is bitter, malty and crisp with some grass and smoked notes. A bit strange, but still somehow quite tasty.Earlier Rating: 5/1/2014 Total Score: 3.4330ml bottle from Mikkeller & Friends

Pours yellowish orange with a smooth head. Aroma of fruits, citrus and mild bready maltiness with hints of smoke. Taste is smooth, fruity and mildly smoky with some bready maltiness. Finish is fruity, malty and mildly smoked. Okay, quite untypical California common.

33 cl bottle.
Pours clear golden color with a large white head, lots of carbonation here. Aroma is very dry and grassy, some hops, pale malts and gooseberry bush. Flavor of mandarin, grassy hops, gooseberries, hay and some more grass. Very dry but yet very refreshing. Crisp.
2514Earlier Rating: 5/1/2014 Total Score: 3.533 cl bottle @ hotel room, Copenhagen.
Pours clear golden color with a large head. Aroma lemon, orange zest, mild smoky notes, some mild hops and toffee. Flavor is fruity and moderately sweet with caramel and hops, mild yeast notes with a grassy finish. Refreshing and nice.
3414

Bottle from Mane Liquor. Pours hazy bright orange with a small sticky white head. Nose doesnt show a heap of smoke but instead comes across very balanced with a fair dose of sweet citric fruits and grass. The smokiness comes out with a bit of warmth. Taste is very citric driven and quite zesty with mild earthiness and mild smoke. Its an odd mix but it works nicely and adds a little something extra to an already good pils
160514. Bottle at home. Pours hazy golden with a nice head. Aroma bread, hops. Earth notes. Some sweet after taste. Ok.
[4/30/14] Draught at Mikkeller & Friends in Copenhagen. Hazy golden. Aroma of leafy green hops. Flavor has mild sweet malt, leafy hops and a decent bitter finish. Medium-bodied.
Draught sample at Mikkeller and Friends (Stefansgade). Pours orange with a nice head, aroma of funk, sulfur and wine, flavor is bitter with grapefruit skin, medium bodied.

Bottle. Golden, hazy,  average and mostly diminishing head. Moderate to full malty and sweetish aroma, light caramel and floral fruitiness with piney - herbal hoppyness, faint alcohol. Body is medium, malty - lightly grainy and lightly sweetish flavor, faint floral fruitiness with herbal - light piney hoppyness, faint alcohol. Finish is average, malty - grainy and dryish, sharp herbal - some piney hoppyness, light alcohol. OK Imperial Pils - not too sweet/not too much alcohol considering the body and bitterness. Finish could use light fruitiness.

bottle at home from brewdog online
mid amber with herbal dry aroma and some higher alcohol/ester notes. foamy offwhite head. at first dry herbal notes with some pithy bitterness in the middle and warming in finish. quite dry herbally notes but the yeast has certainly had a chance to play. quite warming and heavy in the body.

33 cl, bottled. BB 26/02/17. Pours hazy orange with a fine white head. Aroma: Grassy, fruity hops. Balanced malt. Hits of smoke. Taste: More smoke in flavour. Balanced malt, pleasant tones of hops. Medium+ sweet, with a balanced bitterness. Palate: Medium body, pleasant bitter finish. Quite dry finish. Good hopped lager.

Golden body, white head. Aroma has quite cotrussy hops, toasty malt, grass, some quite intense resiny notes. Flavour is very citrussy and some roasted caramel. Some fruitiness. medium bitterness, dry finish.
Bottle from alko, järvenpää. Little hazy golden color, white head. Aroma is nice fresh hops, malty, lemon. Taste is fresh hoppy, malts, hint of lemon.

UPDATED: JUN 9, 2014 33 cl bottle @ hotel room, Copenhagen. BBE 26.02.2017
Aroma has gooseberry bush, some fruity tones and hints of minerals. Flavour has hops, gooseberry bush, fruits, some minerals and grainy tones. More like IPA than CC.

Earlier Rating: 4/17/2014 Total Score: 3.7
33 cl bottle @ home as Primal Pils, BBE 26.02.2017
Aroma is hoppy with exotic fruits and a grainy feeling. Flavour is also rather hoppy with exotic fruits, resiny malt, some caramel and grainy tones. Finishes with lingering hops and gooseberry bush. More like IPA than pils  a good IPA I mean. No signs of smoke or smoked malts.

330 ml bottle. Pours a hazy golden colour with a large foamy head. Aroma of grains, some malts and birch. Flavour of pale malts, birch, mild smoked notes, fresh grass and mild fruitiness. Medium bodied and smooth mouthfeel. Rather nicely balanced with pleasant bitterness.Earlier Rating: 4/17/2014 Total Score: 3.4330 ml bottle. Pours a hazy golden colour with a white head. Aroma of grass, pine and grainy malts. Flavour of floral hops, grapefruit, sweetness, straw, some maltiness and grains. Medium bodied and a citrusy, dry, lingering bitter finish. Good drinkability. A mixture of an imperial pils and an IPA.
Bottle 33 CL. Pours golden hazy sparkly white frothy head. Notes of berries, hops, grass, hay. Interesting.

.33l bottle from Alko JKL 
Pours cloudy apricot with low/medium head. Leaves some lacing. Aroma is hops, malts, citrus fruits. Flavor is hops, malts, citrus fruits, alcohol, soap. Nicely bittery and dry palate. Decent +.
Vaalea väri, pysyvä vaahto. Tuoksussa humalaa, sitrusta. Alkumaussa voimakas humalan puraisu. Jälkimaku pehmeä, hieman karvas.
Tap at Mikkeller&Friends. Hazy amber, small white ring. Aroma is mellow, malt and hay. Flavour is light, softly hoppy and malty. Light, lingering finish.
Very enjoyable strong pilsener with well balanced powerful bitterness in the end.

Hazy honey/golden with thin ring/bit lacing. Hay, nice malty notes. Crisp feel, medium body, standard carbonation, Semisweet, medium long finish is malty, hoppy in a good way, good balance. Easy to drink, tasty.Earlier Rating: 4/9/2014 Total Score: 3.7Cloudy golden, sparkling, 3 finger frothy head is white and medium long. Medium strong fruity-piney aroma is sweet and bitter fresh, tropical fruits like mango and pineapple mixed with bit malting underneath and bit floral notes, good aroma. Fizzy fresh feel with good carbonation, light to medium body, fruity fresh and bitter, bitterness stays to drying finish where malt is more present. Easy to drink, good balance, fresh and refreshing but also tasty. One for summer days and nights. Likes also the reduced to minimal graphic design.
Hazy, medium white head. Damp hoppy aroma, with a flowery flavour. Quite a long finish.

330ml bottle (Alko Arkadia, Helsinki)
Nice grainy pilsner aroma, just a touch of smokiness. Phenols more obvious in the taste, quite woolly. Clear gold if poured carefully, small brief head. Finish has a nice graininess. A bit hot for a sauna beer, I can smell and taste the alcohol vapours. Pretty solid fullsome lager.Earlier Rating: 2/14/2014 Total Score: 3.3Tap (Pudel, Tallinn, To 0l Tap Takeover)
Not much aroma, gentle grainy. Nice pale amber, and nice persistent white tight head. Lovely grainy taste, very nice smokiness. Smoothish palate, crisp (force) carbonation. Rich dark almost husky grainy finish, late finish has some nice hops. A pint of this would be nice!

5th April 2014Lightly hazy amber beer, good pale cream coloured head. Palate is minerally crisp and semi dry. Light smooth malt, whisper of smoke. Light floral orange, touch of citric peel. Mild lactose. Semi dry finish with a whisper of spice.

Bottle from StarmoreBoss, Sheffield. Lightly hazed, pale gold. Thin, tight, sticky, white head. Granary bread. Soft fruitiness. Any smokiness is on the taste, not the aroma, for me (which I know is a nonsense). Anyhow, very tasty. Quite an oddity. Liked it.
Golden, clear with a huge white head. Light aroma, straw, citrus hops, malt. Taste is light sweet, bitter finish, well balanced. Texture is oily, medium carbonation. Good beer.
Bottle.Hazy yellow colour with White head.Aroma is fruity of mandarin and orange peel,feels flowery with notes of hops and yeast,fresh with medium body and light malty finish.

Bottle from Alko Hyvinge. Hazy yellow with Not much head. Rich full hops with smoky aroma. Some bitterness. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Light-medium aroma with some fruitiness and a sharp, bitter tone. Hazy, bronze-yellow color with large, thick white head. Taste is dominated by sharp, bitter taste of hops. Some citrus and fruitiness. Narrow taste spectrum and medium-long, hoppy aftertaste. Ligh-medium palate and medium carbonation.

A golden beer with a big, long and blond head. The nose is nicely aromatic and slightly tropical fruity, also some grain and grass. Taste is citrusfruity, some grain, at least medium bitterness. Medium bodied, nice to drink. Citrusfruity Pils with nice bitterness, not very fresh but otherwise, tastefull.

330 ml bottle. BB 26/02/17. (Alko) Kuopio, Finland.
Lively cloudy golden colour with a big foamy white head. 
Tropical fruits, mild grass, candies and pine in the American hoppy aroma. Quite smooth. The flavour is grapefruity, resiny and piney hops and some balancing malt. Quite nice. Danish style brew. Bitterness stays.

Kaatuu kapeaan lasiin kullankeltaisena ja kirkkaana, todella muhkealla ja pitsiä jättävällä vaahdolla. Hajussa ensimmäisenä aistinkarvoille törmää jenkkihumalien tuoma sitrus ja etenkin trooppinen hedelmäisyys. Alla on perinteisempää makeaa voimaisuutta ja hyvin kevyttä viljaisuutta, muttei niin paljoa kuin pilseissä yleensä. Maku on saman suuntainen, jenkkihumalainen sitrus ja kypsempi hedelmä jyrää, taustalla on hiven ruohoisuutta ja hieman makeampaa otetta. Suutuntuma on todella hiilihappoinen ja katkerotkin hyökkäävät kovasti suuhun. Tuntuu jopa hieman karkealta. Ihan hyvä pils, mutta itse olen alkanut arvostamaan perinteisempää viljaisuutta ja sen ympärille nivoutuvaa katkeroa, en näitä jenkkihumalan ympärille rakennettuja pilsejä.

Bottle 330ml (Alko)
Yellow, a bit hazy color, small white head. Strong gooseberry - cat piss aroma. Medium-bodied. Fruity, a bit sweet tropical flavor in front. Then goosenberry, rhubarb. When you know it: light touch of smokeyness in the finish. So full of fruity and aromatic hops that it feels more like an ale than a pils.Earlier Rating: 3/27/2014 Total Score: 3.2Bottle at Beer Hunters. 
Slightly hazy golden color, small white head. Fruity, a bit grainy aroma. Light hoppyness. Light-bodied to medium-bodied. Flavor is fruity and has light citrus notes, perhaps some grainyness too. Tickle of alcohol. Interesting steam beer.

Duft: sød, malt, lidt røg, citrus, frugt duft.
Smag: pilsner malt smag. sødme. en fin eftersmag af røg.

330 ml bottle. Slightly hazy golden colour, thin white head. Aroma of grassy hops, with malty and sweetish fruity notes. The flavour is predominantly grassy-hoppy, with malt and citrus notes in the background. Nice and refreshing.
Bottle 33c from alko @ home. Pours very slightly hazy golden with a white head. Tropical fruits, peaches, some hay in the aroma. Citrus, fruity hops, some grass in the flavor.

bottle. golden, nice colour. green hoppy, lime-zest citrus, nose. quite refreshing actually. dry bitter body, but not really too harsh, just a bit. cant really taste the maltyness that much, too much of the hops and all. overall a hoppy .. pale .. something. a bit grainy in the finish. and oh, the smokyness goes pretty much undetected unless youre aware of it. becomes part of the slight murky, grainy, finish.
Bottle. Mostly clear golden color with a medium thin white head. Aroma of peach and floral hops. Sweet and bitter taste. Medium body. Refreshing.

33cl bottle. Bb 02/17. Unclear golden, thick, white head that lasts. Gooseberries and floral hoppy aroma, some cat pee. Flavor has gooseberries, floral notes, lemony notes, malt. Finish is bitter and sharp, quite long. Fruity and hoppy for an imperial pils. Tasty, but the sharpness in the finsh I was not that fond of.
Hazy golden color with beautiful lasting head. Aroma is grassy hops. Flavor is hoppy, malty and bitter.
0,33l bottle from Alko. Pours hazy golden with a high head. Aroma is malts with some alcohol and a hint of smoke. Flavor is malts and hops. Not bad.

Bottle. Hazy, almost dirty golden colour with small white head.
Mild aroma with hint of tropical fruits, hay, crass and some sweetness.
Also surprisingly mild on flavors, some sweetness, hay, malt...
Medium bodied with soft carbonation.
Sweet finish with mild bitter hopiness. Not very crispy nor fresh.
Drank this after "Hop love pils" and it was kind of hard to say anything about this. Bland.

Bottle 33 cl, BBE 02/2017. Pours slightly unclear golden in color with a frothy white head. 

Sweetish hay, southern garden fruits, light rubbery and old cellar notes in aroma. Fairly 

bitter in taste with green grass and grapefruit mixed with slightly sweet and burnt malty notes 

as well. Later on the bitterness is still present quite strongly, but with more of them southern 

garden fruity elements being present, as well as some hints of smoky saltyness appearing in 

aftertaste.
Bottle from Alko. Amber color, white head. Bitter taste with citrus, mango, hops, grass, resin and pine. Bitter finish with citrus, mango and hops. Very nice imperial lager.

Hazy light orange beer with a fluffy huge white head leaving lacing on the glass. Aroma has sweet orange, pale malts, yeast and a little bit of burned rubber. Flavor is mild - mostly bitter with slight pale maltiness, yeastiness, orange, burned rubber and alcohol.  Finishes with a decent bite of bitterness, leading into a longer dry bitter aftertaste. Palate is medium full and quite strongly carbonated. This style just doesnt seem to work even with the greatest brewers. Kinda surprising that nothing is overdone, leaves kind of a bland feeling.

Bottle 330ml. [ As To Øl Stalins Organ ].Clear medium yellow orange color with a average to large, frothy, good lacing, mostly lasting, off-white to white head. Aroma is moderate malty, toasted, pale malt, moderate hoppy, grass, citrus, pine. Flavour is moderate to light light heavy sweet and moderate bitter with a long duration, citrus - pine, hoppy, zest bitter, minerals, light salty. Body is medium to medium full, texture is oily, carbonation is soft. [20140212]
cereal, bread, spruce, amber, hazy, cloudy, frothy, white foam, medium sweetness, medium bitterness, medium sourness, medium body, oily feel, thin feel, lively, bitter,

#20 To Øl beer. Thx! to ST247 & Kraddel. 33 cl. bottle sampled. A label from To Øl that I find ungly, now this is rare. Anyway, hazy orange with a white head. Nose is very mellow, getting almost nothing here, mild orange, carambola, lemon, very faint. Taste is nice mellow smoke upfront, touch more meaty than campfire, leading into mild sweetness, white sugar, caramel, passion fruit, orange, carambola, peach, dry, Touch yeasty body, tad fuller for what one expect from the style. One can argue in what extend anyone can call a steam beer this hoppy and smoked on top still a steam beer but that is just semantics and this is quite a pleasant beer.
Bottle shared with Kraddel. Pours cloudy golden with white head. Fruity, hoppy aroma. Medium bitterness. Dry aftertaste fruity taste and bit smoked.

Bottle Thnx to ST247
Pours fuzzy blonde , rather small white head
Bit malty, unintence smell , hint of smoke
Taste is Bit smoked, bitter maltyness . Ok , but not my thing .

Bottle shared at Herr Schmitts gaff. Pale golden colour with a thin lasting white head. Aroma is lemon, grassy, midget gems, some alcohol. Flavour is smoked malt, phenols, grassy hops some citrus. Firm smooth bitterness. Light palate. Highiah carbonation. Not really a Cali common.

Bottle shared at Garbage Night II - London. Thanks to Fergus for this beer. Pours clear, yellow-gold with a frothy white head. The nose has sweet pale bread, a bit of ham, perhaps some white grape. Light to medium sweet flavor with further white bread, faint smoke, mild straw bitters, light bodied with fine to average carbonation. Nicely balanced to finish with dry white bread, light grains, a bit more dry smoke, hay. Very tasty beer. Novel and quite drinkable.

Bottle thats to Fergus. It pours clear golden with a medium white head. The nose is doughy, icing sugar, hay and glazed donut, The taste is toasty, earth, grain, orange peel, mandarin, sherbet, candied peel and light smoke with a dry, citric finish. Medium body and fine carbonation. Decent.

Bottle 33 cl. Pours an almost clear golden with a white head. Malty aroma with a flowery hop note - no real impact of the smoked malt at this stage. Medium body, sweet, clean malts and a slight and spicy smoky note, Bamberg style. Hoppy, bitter finish. Quite solid. 170314
330ml bottle from Brewdog online shop. Aromas of burnt orange, sugar. Burnt orange taste, smoke coming through stronger. Rich cranny mouthfeel, nice smoky linger. Good.

33cl bottle thanks to allmyvinyl.
Appearance - hazy golden orange with a generous creamy head. 
Nose - burnt orange, maybe even Seville. 
Taste - burnt oranges again with the smoke being persistent.
Palate - medium bodied with a tangy/smoky texture and a long dry and refreshing but smoky finish.
Overall - a thinking mans beer.

Draft @ Mikkeller & Friends, Copenhagen. Pours a clear golden color with a small white head. Has a fruity malty grainy aroma. Fruity malty grainy flavor with weak smoky hints. Has a fruity malty grainy weak smoky and weak hoppy finish.

Bottle, bought @ YNWA Beershop, Kolding. Pours clear amber with a large, staying, creamy, white head. Aroma has peach, grapefruit, caramel, light smoke. Medium carbonation, fine dry and quite creamy mouthfeel. Flavour has good crisp malts, hops, grapefruit, peach, mild smoky. Good lingering bitterness.

27.02.2014, tap @ Mikkeller & Friends:
Nice creamy mediumlasting head. Aroma is slightly sweet fruity, caramel malts, hay, toffee, leafs, grass, dried fruits, butterscotch, hints of smoke. Taste is slightly dry grassy, light malts, hay, leafs, hops, caramel, grass, hints of smoke. Medium bitterness, slightly dry mouthfeel. Nice.

Flaske, 33 cl. Uklar orange-gylden med et forholdsvis let hvidt skum. Mild, men markeret røg. Citrus-noter. Crisp, sødmefuld men ikke sød, maltet krop. God afsluttende bitterhed. Interessant take på steam beer.

Draught @ Mikkeller & Friends. Pours near clear orange with a small frothy off-white head. Aroma is smoke, grain, hops. Taste is light+ sweet and bitter. Body is light, texture is oily, carbonation is moderate. Finishes light dry. Fine drinkability.

Powiedzmy takie sobie. Estry wyraznie owocow kwaskowych. Grejfrut kwasna pomarancza. Wyglad piwa to jasna barwa przejrzysta i klarowna. Piana srednia ale trwala. W smaku wspomniane owoce kwaskowe. Cytrusowe na koncu i delikatne. Etykieta troche oderwana od rzeczywistosci i nazwa piwa troche prowokujaca.

Botella de 33 cl en el lúpulo en el momento el 22-02-2014. Color rubio hacia miel con muy poca espuma. Ligeros toques ahumados para una cerveza de cuerpo ligero medio con 6 vol bastante maltosa pero fresca y fácil de beber. Toques afrutados al principio. Bastante buena y bastante peculiar con sabores maltosos, ligeramente afrutados y amargos con un toque ahumado muy muy interesante. para repetir sin problemas.
Tap. Clear amber color. Small size, white head, stays. Malty, sweet, raw grainy aroma. Rubber, leather, smoke, peat in taste. Bit unbalanced. Confusing beer.
@ Havregatan. Flaska från Ölbutikken, Köpenham. Småfruktig, gräs, malttoner, torr, besk. Lång besk avslutning.

Clear orange, with decent lacing. Aroma of citrus fruit and gentle hops. Malty, hoppy and kind of an IPA. Offsetting aftertaste. Medium bodied, pleasantly carbonated. Smokey and again new mixture for me.

Gylden klar skum hvid 
Humle citrus græs salt
Bitter meget sød 
Oile fyldig 
@f1

Bottle at Home. Pours a clear golden with a small white head. Dry with mellow, sprucy hops aromas. Also mellow aromas of pale malts and smoked malts. Hints of alcohol. Medium bodied. Medium carbonation. Dry finish.

Bottle. Light hazy yellow, medium sized frothy white head. Dominated by meaty smoke with light grassy hops and grain. The smoke isn't overwhelming. Light/medium body, oily texture, medium carbonation, light sweet, medium bitter. Light dry and bitter finish. Refreshing and easy to drink.

Bottle.
Nice clear golden. Off-white frothy head.
Not much nose, a little fruit. Taste is nice and crisp, malty finish. 
Average carbonation. Good beer!

Bottle from Mikkeller & Friends Bottle Shop. Hazy golden with a medium white head. This beer is easy to drink and soft. Notes of smoke, also grape and hay. The finish was dry. An ok one although nothing special.
Bottled. A golden beer with a beige head. The aroma has notes of malt, smoke, caramel, and hops. The flavor is sweet with notes of malt, smoke, straw, and fruits, leading to a bitter finish.

Bottle at home.
Hazy golden coloured with a small white head.
Fruity aroma of bread, hops and peaches.
Fruity flavour of brad, hops and grass with notes of coffee and smoke.
Hoppy finish.

33 cl bottle. Pours hazy yellow to orange with a thick and white head. Aroma is peachy and light grapefruity, floral hoppy. Dry, bitter, mild herbal to light burned note. Bitter, light fruity and mild lasting burned note into the far finish.

Bottle at home - shared with Mette - Christmas evening. Clear amber/golden - white head. Light smokey aroma. Ok bitterness. Toasted. Grassy. Light to medium malty. Ok body. Light fatness. Nice - but give me more smoke.
